{{Infobox college athletics |name = West Florida Argonauts |logo = UWF Argonauts.jpg |logo_size = 200px |university = University of West Florida |conference = [[Gulf South Conference|Gulf South Conference - East Division]] |division = Division II |director = [[Dave Scott (UWF Athletic Director)|Dave Scott]] |city = Pensacola |state = Florida |stateabb = FL |teams = 13 |baseballfield = [[Pelican Park]] |arena = [[UWF Field House]] |mascot = Argie the Argonaut |nickname = Argos/Argonauts |color1 = Blue |color2 = Green |hex1 = 0066CC |hex2 = 006600 |pageurl = http://goargos.athleticsite.com/ |pagename = Go Argos }} The '''West Florida Argonauts''' are composed of 13 NCAA sports teams which make up the athletic program for the [[University of West Florida]]. ==Athletic Department== UWF intercollegiate athletics compete in the [[NCAA]] [[Division II (NCAA)|Division II]] [[Gulf South Conference]]. Men's intercollegiate sports: [[Baseball]], [[Soccer]], [[Basketball]], [[Tennis]], [[Cross country running|Cross country]], and [[Golf]]. Women's intercollegiate sports: [[Basketball]], [[Tennis]], [[Cross country running|Cross country]], [[Golf]], [[Softball]], [[Soccer]], and [[Volleyball]]. ==Achievements== '''NCAA Division II National Championships:''' *2011 Baseball *2008 Men's Golf *2006 Men's Tennis *2005 Men's Tennis *2001 Men's Golf '''Gulf South Conference All Sports Trophies:''' *2005-06 Women's *2003-04 Women's *2002-03 Men's *1998-99 Women's *1997-98 Men's *1997-98 Women's '''Gulf South Conference Championships:''' {| class="wikitable" |- ! Baseball ! Men's Cross Country ! Men's Golf ! Men's Soccer ! Men's Tennis ! Women's Cross Country ! Women's Golf ! Women's Soccer ! Women's Softball ! Women's Tennis !  |} ==Athletic Songs== According to a March 2008 edition of the Voyager, UWF will have a fight song once SGA decides through voting. ==Mascot== UWF's official mascot is the [[Argonaut]], a mythical group of Greek sailors, who accompanied Jason to Colchis in his quest for the Golden Fleece. However, the official logo of the institution is the Chambered Nautilus; because of this, students jokingly refer to themselves as the UWF "Fighting Snails." ==Possibility of a Football Program, Moving to NCAA Division I== According to local papers, UWF has recently created an "Athletics Visioning Team" for 2009. The purpose of this team is to find out whether or not the time is now appropriate for UWF to move its athletic programs up to NCAA Division I, and/or possibly add a football program.Pensacola News Journal - [http://www.pnj.com/article/20090106/SPORTS/901060324/1002 UWF Aims to Boost Athletics] On March 15, 2010, UWF President Judith Bense announced that she will make a decision regarding adding football by Summer 2011 and that the University had committed to playing in [[Division II (NCAA)|Division II]] for at least the next 10 years.[http://goargos.com/article.asp?articleID=3735 UWF President to Make Decision on Football by Summer 2011] ==See also== *[[University of West Florida]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://goargos.athleticsite.com/ Official website] {{University of West Florida}} {{Gulf South Conference}} [[Category:University of West Florida]] [[Category:Gulf South Conference]]
